questions.question:
Jose Palacios, his oldest servant, found him floating naked with his eyes open in the purifying waters of his bath and thought he had drowned. He knew this was, one of the many ways the General meditated, but the ecstasy in which he lay drifting seemed that of a man no longer of this world.
Gabriel Garcia Marquez, The General in His Labyrinth
The master in the passage above is obviously in a state of
questions.correction: The master in the passage above is obviously in a state of 'Trance'.

questions.question: A metrical pause occurring in the middle of a line in a poem is called
questions.correction: A metrical pause occurring in the middle of a line in a poem is called 'Caesura'.

questions.question:
'The fair breeze blew
The white foam flew
The furrow followed free
We were the first that ever burst
Into that silent sea.'

The dominant figure of speech in the above passage is
questions.correction: The dominant figure of speech in the passage is 'Rhyme scheme'.

questions.question:
'Careened',
These oily tears
Dripping down the tears on your depressed face,
Will one day be staunched, I swear!
Ibiwari Ikiriko, Oily Tears.

The tone of the poet is
questions.correction: The tone of the poet is 'Sympathetic'.

questions.question:
CYCLIST gets down and begins to prop his bicycle.
CYCLIST: All right. If you're sure it won't take long.
BARBER: I am known for my lightning clippers. Even the soldiers know me. I can shave the head of an entire battalion between one coup and the next. Sit down and relax your back. Cycling is not easy when you've abandoned it for some time.
Wole Soyinka, The Beautification of Area Boy.

The literary devices in the dialogue above are
questions.correction: The literary devices in the dialogue above are 'Hyperbole and allusion'.

questions.question:
'I had not taken the first step in knowledge, I had not learnt to let go with the hands'.
The above line is an example of a
questions.correction: The above line is an example of 'Repetition'.

questions.question:
This question is based on CAGED BIRD.
Read this excerpt from the poem and answer questions.
'The free bird thinks of another
breeze / and the trade winds
soft through the sighing trees'

What is the effect of the trees sighing in this verse?
questions.optiona: It shows where the bird sleeps
questions.optionb: It shows the tree is sleeping
questions.optionc: It indicates that the bird is carefree
questions.optiond: It indicates that it is still early in the day
questions.correction: The effect of the trees sighing in this verse is that 'It indicates that the bird is carefree'.

questions.question:
Don't panic. Be calm. If you are somehow upset...try to regain your composure.
The speaker in the excerpt above is
questions.correction: The speaker in the excerpt above is 'Confident'.

questions.question:
This question is based on A GOVERNMENT DRIVER ON HIS RETIREMENT.
'I shall booze and zoom' contains a device called
questions.correction: 'I shall booze and zoom' contains a device called 'Alliteration'.

questions.question:
'The sun used to smile in my hut'.

The line is an example of
questions.correction: The line is an example of 'Personification'.

questions.question: The use of two contrasting words that are placed side by side is called
questions.correction: The use of two contrasting words that are placed side by side is called 'Oxymoron'.

questions.question: The combination of two or more metaphors is called
questions.correction: The combination of two or more metaphors is called 'Mixed metaphor'.

questions.question: ________ are generally regarded as brief but purposeful references, within a literary text, to a person, place, event, or to another work of literature.
questions.correction: 'Allusions' are generally regarded as brief but purposeful references within a literary text.

questions.question: An action in a play that stimulates the audience to pity a character is
questions.correction: An action in a play that stimulates the audience to pity a character is 'Pathos'.

questions.question:
This question is based on BAT.
Use the excerpt to answer this question.
'Where light pushes through;
A sudden turning upon itself of a thing in the air.
A dip to the water.
And you think:
'The swallows are flying so late!'
Swallows?'

The dominant poetic device in the excerpt is
questions.correction: The dominant poetic device in the excerpt is 'Imagery'.

questions.question: When an object is invested with a meaning beyond its immediate reference, it becomes
questions.correction: When an object is invested with a meaning beyond its immediate reference, it becomes 'A symbol'.

questions.question: A story with elements that have both literal and figurative meanings is
questions.correction: A story with elements that have both literal and figurative meanings is an 'Allegory'.

questions.question: A tragic hero, according to the Aristotelian precept, must be a
questions.optiona: Central character after whom the play is named
questions.optionb: King with deep affection for his subjects
questions.optiond: Lowly character who suddenly stumbles on some fortunes
questions.correction: A tragic hero, according to the Aristotelian precept, must be a 'Noble character with hubris'.

questions.question:
This question is based on RAIDER OF THE TREASURE TROVE.
The poetic device in the expression 'Rage is chief' is
questions.correction: The poetic device in the expression 'Rage is chief' is 'Metaphor'.

questions.question:
*For seven days it rained that June;
A storm half out to sea kept turning around like a dog trying to settle himself on a rug; We were the fleas that complained in his hair.
John Updike, Wash

The image set in the lines above are of
questions.correction: The image set in the lines above are of 'Discomfort and likely destruction'.

questions.question: The overwhelming pride that destroys the tragic hero is called
questions.correction: The overwhelming pride that destroys the tragic hero is called 'Hubris'.

questions.question:
'Fierce harmattan sun on innocent tendrils; torrential downpour on leaking thatch roofs; painful comfort of helpless eunuchs; thorny beauty of modern witches; the falcon's call on day-old-chicks, ours is a tragicomic dialogue:... mute echoes of pains' .

The sonority and rhythmical structure of the lines above are achieved through a pause-pattern called
questions.correction: The sonority and rhythmical structure of the lines above are achieved through a pause-pattern called 'Caesura'.

questions.question:
This question is based on BLACK WOMAN.
'fruit with firm flesh' illustrates the use of ____
questions.correction: 'fruit with firm flesh' illustrates the use of 'Alliteration'.

questions.question:
'Senhor Jose got cold during the night. After having uttered those redundant useless words, here she is, he wasn't sure what else he should do. It was true that, after long and arduous labours, he had managed, at last, to find the unknown woman, or rather, the place where she lay, a good six feet beneath an earth that still sustained him'
Jose Saramago: All the Names

What happens to the unknown woman in the passage above?
questions.correction: The unknown woman in the passage above is 'dead'.

questions.question:
This question is based on THE GOOD MORROW.
Use this excerpt to answer question
'If ever any beauty I did see,
Which I desired, and got, 'twas but a dream of thee.'

The excerpt above evokes the use of ____
questions.correction: The excerpt above evokes the use of 'Visual imagery'.

questions.question: The moment of recognition of truth when ignorance gives way to knowledge is known as
questions.correction: The moment of recognition of truth when ignorance gives way to knowledge is known as 'Anagnorisis'.

questions.question: A long story narrating a series of complicated events is called a
questions.correction: A long story narrating a series of complicated events is called a 'Saga'.

questions.question:
This question is based on A GOVERNMENT DRIVER ON HIS RETIREMENT.
'Many years on wheels' The reference to 'wheels' exemplifies the use of ___ in the poem.
questions.correction: 'Many years on wheels' The reference to 'wheels' exemplifies the use of 'Metonymy' in the poem.

questions.question: A novel that features spiritual apparitions as major character is
questions.correction: A novel that features spiritual apparitions as major character is 'Gothic'.

questions.question:
This question is based on SECOND CLASS CITIZEN.
The novel is set after which major war?
questions.correction: The novel is set after 'The Nigerian Civil War (1967-1970)'.

questions.question:
This question is based on LOOK BACK IN ANGER.
What were the other businesses Jimmy Porter had tried apart from the sweet stall business?
questions.correction: Jimmy Porter had tried 'Journalism, advertising, and vacuum cleaning' apart from the sweet stall business.

questions.question:
This question is based on THE LION AND THE JEWEL.
The use of language in the play is written in both___ and ___ forms.
questions.correction: The use of language in the play is written in both 'Prosaic and poetic.' forms.

questions.question:
This question is based on UNEXPECTED JOY AT DAWN.
Which of these characters is at the center of the impact of the xenophobic attack in the novel?
questions.correction: The character at the center of the impact of the xenophobic attack in the novel is 'Ezla'.

questions.question:
This question is based on THE LION AND THE JEWEL.
Sidi insisted on the payment of her bride-price because it indicates that she_____
questions.correction: Sidi insisted on the payment of her bride-price because it indicates that she 'Is a virgin'.

questions.question:
This question is based on THE LION AND THE JEWEL.
In the play, the jewel of Ilujinle is____
questions.correction: In the play, the jewel of Ilujinle is 'Sidi'.

questions.question:
This question is based on UNEXPECTED JOY AT DAWN.
How did Mama Orojo meet Tom Monday?
questions.optiona: She met him on her trip to Ghana
questions.optionb: She met him on an evangelism trip
questions.optionc: She met him during the religious riot
questions.optiond: She met him at the restaurant
questions.correction: Mama Orojo met Tom Monday 'During the religious riot'.

questions.question:
This question is based on LOOK BACK IN ANGER.
Who was the first person Alison informed about her pregnancy?
questions.correction: The first person Alison informed about her pregnancy was 'Jimmy'.

questions.question:
PROSE: AFRICAN: UNEXPECTED JOY AT DAWN
What distinguishes Nii Tackie from every other Ghanaian?
questions.correction: What distinguishes Nii Tackie from every other Ghanaian is 'His accent'.

questions.question:
This question is based on WUTHERING HEIGHT.
What gift did Mr. Earnshaw promise to bring Nelly Dean from Liverpool?
questions.correction: Mr. Earnshaw promised to bring Nelly Dean a 'Fiddle' from Liverpool.

questions.question:
This question is based on SECOND CLASS CITIZEN.
Who is Mr Cole?
questions.optiona: A black tenant at the first apartment in England
questions.optionc: Adah's nephew she's forced to live with after Pa's death
questions.correction: Mr. Cole is 'Adah's colleague at the Consulate'.

questions.question: A limerick has
questions.optiona: ornate style, humour, irony and seven lines
questions.optionb: formal and elaborate style and humour
questions.optiond: a stinging climax, rhyme scheme, and five lines
questions.correction: A humorous short poem with two long lines that rhyme with each other followed by two short lines that rhyme with each other and ending with a long line that rhymes with the first two. The rhyme scheme is usually aabba.

questions.question: The process of creating character and endowing them with certain attitude is ......
questions.correction: Characterization is the process by which the writer reveals the personality of a character. It is the method used by a writer to develop a character. This can be done directly by the author or indirectly through the actions, thoughts, and speech of the character.

questions.instruction: This question is based on BAT.
questions.question:
Read the excerpt and answer questions
"Bat!
Creatures that hang themselves up like an old rag, to sleep, And disgustingly upside down."

The theme of this excerpt is____
questions.optionb: the poet right to Individual choice
questions.optionc: the poet admiration of the beauty of nature
questions.optiond: the poet appalling remarks about the bird
questions.correction: The theme of the excerpt is the poet's appalling remarks about the bird. The poet describes the bat in a negative light, comparing it to an 'old rag' and expressing disgust at its sleeping habits.

questions.question: The writing convention in which the events in narrative are scrambled as they come to the writer's mind without any attempt to arrange them in orderly sequence is called
questions.correction: The writing convention in which the events in a narrative are presented as they come to the writer's mind, without any attempt to arrange them in an orderly sequence, is called 'stream of consciousness'. This style seeks to depict the myriad thoughts and feelings which pass through the mind. Therefore, the option 'stream of consciousness' is correct.

questions.question: Using the name of one thing for something else with which it is closely associated in an instance is
questions.correction:
It is the act of using a well-known object to represent the holder or user.
e.g: "I miss my home" *home here means "family"

questions.question: Which of these is the oldest genre of literature?
questions.correction: Poetry is considered the oldest form of literature. It dates back to prehistoric times when oral storytelling was the primary method of communication. Poetry was used to tell stories, record history, express emotions, and convey ideas. It predates the written word and was used in ancient civilizations for religious rituals, songs, and storytelling. The other options, Drama and Prose, came later in the history of literature.

questions.question: The tragic character is the person whose experiences arouse pity and
questions.correction: In literature, a tragic character is one that experiences a downfall due to their own flaw or mistake. The downfall of this character arouses feelings of pity and fear (or terror) in the audience. This is a concept known as 'catharsis', a term used by Aristotle in his work 'Poetics', to describe the feelings of pity and fear that the audience feels for the tragic hero.

questions.question:
'As virtuous men pass mildly away,
And whisper to their souls, to go
Whilst some of their sad friends do say,
The breadth goes now, and some say, "No".'
John Donne: A Valediction: Forbidding Mourning

The tone of this poem is generally
questions.correction: Subject of death is being elucidated in the quatrain. Because death is a serious issue, the tone is serious.

questions.question: Cast in a play refers to
questions.optionc: an exclusive social class in the play
questions.correction: Cast in a play refers to all the actors. We can as well call such actors and actresses the dramatis personae.

questions.question: A panegyric poem is composed to
questions.correction: The panegyric poem is composed to offer high praisre to a person or thing. It is also known as a eulogy.

questions.question:
Jibunoh was simply a difficult man. He was hated by all his neighbours and deserted by his relations. He was the first and only person to beat a policeman in the entire village. He also had ten cases instituted against him for either stealing or violating the rights of others. He had no regard for deanery or normal conduct. No lover of peace or order could be his friends. It is not surprising that his death elicited jubilation rather than mourning'

The passage above reveals that Jibunoh symbolizes
questions.correction: The passage describes Jibunoh as a man who is difficult, hated, and has no regard for law or order. He has been involved in multiple cases of theft and violation of others' rights. This description symbolizes 'lawlessness'. Lawlessness refers to a state of disorder due to a disregard of the law. In this context, Jibunoh's actions and the reactions of others towards him represent a state of lawlessness.

questions.question:
Jibunoh was simply a difficult man. He was hated by all his neighbours and deserted by his relations. He was the first and only person to beat a policeman in the entire village. He also had ten cases instituted against him for either stealing or violating the rights of others. He had no regard for deanery or normal conduct. No lover of peace or order could be his friends. It is not surprising that his death elicited jubilation rather than mourning'

The plot of the novel is
questions.correction: The plot of the novel is linear; Events in the novel succeed into one another in one to one correspondence right from the point to exposition to climax to anti-climax to denouement.

questions.question: The part of a play when climax approaches is known as
questions.correction: This is a climax literary point in which the audience reacts to what the character (protagonist) experiences. It is known as (release of purgation).

questions.question:
'And so Tom awoke and we rose in the dark
And got with our bags and our brushes to work
Though the morning was cold, Tom was happy and warm;
So if all do their duty they need not fear harm.'

In the lines above, Tom is warm because he
questions.correction: In the lines above, Tom is warm because he is doing his duty. The last line of the poem states, 'So if all do their duty they need not fear harm.' This suggests that Tom's warmth is not a result of just waking from sleep, wearing warm clothes, or working indoors, but rather from the satisfaction and fulfillment derived from doing his duty.

questions.question: The term given to a type of incident or device which recurs frequently in Literature is
questions.correction: Motif is a literary technique that consists of a repeated element that has symbolic significance to a literary work. Sometimes, a motif is a recurring image. Other times, it's a repeated word, phrase, or topic expressed in language.

questions.question: An extended fictional narrative which is realistic is known as a
questions.correction: A novel is a fictional narrative which is realistic and of a certain length. Diary is never fictional. Novella and short story are limitedly realistic fictions.

questions.question: A Government Driver on His Retirement is a poem of thirty-three lines divided into _______ stanzas.
questions.correction: A Government Driver on His Retirement is a poem of thirty-three lines divided into six stanzas. Stanzas 1, 2, 4 and 5 have four lines each while Stanzas 3 and 6 have eight and nine lines respectively.

questions.instruction: This question is based on THE JOURNEY OF THE MAGI.
questions.question:
Read the excerpt and answer question
"And running away, and wanting their liquor and women,
And the night-fires going out, and the lack of shelters,
And the cities hostile and the towns unfriendly"

The dominant device in this excerpt is ___
questions.correction: The dominant device in the excerpt from 'The Journey of the Magi' is synecdoche. Synecdoche is a figure of speech in which a part is made to represent the whole or vice versa. In this case, 'night-fires going out' and 'lack of shelters' are used to represent the overall hardships and difficulties of the journey. The device is not paradox, metaphor, or simile, as there is no contradiction, comparison, or likeness being expressed.

questions.question: The sides of a stage are called
questions.correction: In theatre terminology, the sides of a stage are referred to as 'the wings'. This is where actors prepare to enter the stage and where props may be stored ready for use.

questions.question:
Be him English

Be him African

Be him Nigerian

The lines above are an example of
questions.correction: Anaphora refers to the repetition of certain words or phrase at the begining of each sentence or line in a poem

questions.question:
When he gave me the bottle, and I opened it,
I was shocked by the odour that hit my nose:
I immediately corked it again, and spat on the floor..
Isidore Okpewho, The Last Duty.

The reaction in the passage above is that of
questions.correction: The reaction in the passage above is that of nausea. The character is shocked by the odour that hits his nose when he opens the bottle, and he immediately corks it again and spits on the floor. This reaction is indicative of a feeling of nausea, which is a sensation of unease and discomfort in the upper stomach with an involuntary urge to vomit.

questions.question: A formal dignified speech or writing praising or a thing for past or present deeds is
questions.correction: A eulogy is a formal speech or piece of writing that praises someone or something highly, typically someone who has just died. Therefore, the correct answer is 'eulogy'. An anthology is a published collection of poems or other pieces of writing. A lampoon is a speech or text criticizing someone or something humorously. A premiere is the first performance of a play or the first showing of a movie.

questions.question: A character that is always against the interest of the protagonist is
questions.correction: In literature, a character that is always against the interest of the protagonist is referred to as a villain. A villain is a character whose evil actions or motives are important to the plot.

questions.question:
"...Rage is Chief
Rage drags rags after you, of Charity
Laughter, sweetness and light, Rage is thief
Enemy of equanimity"

The figure of speech dominant in these lines is _____
questions.correction: Writers use personification to give human characteristics, such as emotions and behaviors, to non-human things, animals, and ideas.

questions.question:
'... Not a few of us ended our application letter like this: 'if you are kind enough to accomodate this humble application, Sir/Madam, I shall do my uttermost best to rendered you the greatest services which it is at my desposition to your best satisfactory. Yours obediently servant...' yet without English, you had no education fit for a white collar job
Cameron Daodu: The Gab Boys

The tone of the passage above is
questions.correction: The tone of the passage from Cameron Daodu's The Gab Boys is derisive. The author is mocking the overly formal and somewhat incorrect English used in the application letter. Derisive tone is used to ridicule or mock, often with sarcasm or satire.

questions.question: A trilogy is the
questions.optiona: set of three one-act drama written by related authors
questions.optionb: series of related stories divided into three equal parts
questions.optionc: sequence of three plays written by the same author
questions.optiond: collection of three poems of equal length
questions.correction: A trilogy is a set of three works of literature, films, or plays that are connected and can be seen either as a single work or as three individual works. They are usually written by the same author. Therefore, a trilogy is a sequence of three plays written by the same author.

questions.question: Dramatis personae in a play refers to
questions.correction: Dramatis personae in a play refers to the list of characters. It is a Latin phrase meaning 'the characters of the play'. It is usually used at the beginning of a script for a play, before the action begins, to present the characters and their relationships to one another.

questions.instruction: This question is based on SECOND CLASS CITIZEN.
questions.question: "She swallowed it all, just like a nasty pill." The literary device employed here is
questions.correction: The phrase 'She swallowed it all, just like a nasty pill' employs the literary device of simile. A simile is a figure of speech that makes a comparison between two different things using the words 'like' or 'as'. In this case, the author compares the act of swallowing a nasty pill to accepting a difficult situation.

questions.question:
'My heart is a quiet drum, something it flares like a parched thunder cracking through a damask sky it lifts me in its fired spectacle.'
-Cynthia James; Drumology

The imagery in the excerpt above is largely
questions.correction: The excerpt from Cynthia James' Drumology uses auditory and visual imagery. The auditory imagery is evident in phrases like 'quiet drum' and 'parched thunder cracking', which appeal to the sense of hearing. The visual imagery is seen in phrases like 'flares like a parched thunder' and 'cracking through a damask sky', which appeal to the sense of sight.

questions.question:
"She wanted to split herself. But she checked herself. 'Get dressed,' she said earnestly. 'Get dressed and let's go. You know I have a lot of things to do. And if we are going to meet again like this... 'She slapped the bed, 'then it won't be here. It will be at the Samson and Delilah.'" -
Festus Iyayi; Violence

In the passage above, the speaker can be described as
questions.correction: In the passage, the speaker is commanding another person to get dressed and stating that if they are to meet again, it will be at a location of her choosing. This suggests that the speaker is in control of the situation and is making decisions for both herself and the other person, which is characteristic of a domineering personality. The other options (treacherous, friendly, hungry) do not accurately describe the speaker's behavior in this passage.

questions.instruction: This question is based on THE LION AND THE JEWEL.
questions.question: The indication that Soyinka's "The Lion and the Jewel" is culturally set is its use of_____
questions.correction: The cultural setting of Wole Soyinka's 'The Lion and the Jewel' is indicated by its use of dance and songs. These elements are integral parts of Yoruba culture, which is the cultural background of the play.

questions.instruction: This question is based on THE LEADER AND THE LED.
questions.question: " The hyena says the crown is made for him" in the above excerpt, the use of the word "crown " is a good deployment of ____
questions.correction: The use of the word 'crown' in this context is a good example of synecdoche, a figure of speech in which a part is made to represent the whole or vice versa. Here, 'crown' is used to represent power or leadership, which is a part of the whole concept of being a king or ruler.

questions.question: The exclusive right given to authors to protect their works from unlawful production is
questions.correction: A copyright prevents other people from producing an intellectual work without the permission of the author.

questions.question: The narrative style in which the hero tells his own story directly is the
questions.correction: This is a style of writing where the narrator is a character in the novel and uses 'I', 'We','Me', 'ourselves', 'myself'.

questions.question: Lineation refers to
questions.optiona: the arrangement of lines in verse form
questions.optionb: the grouping together of a number of units of rhythm
questions.optionc: the unit in the rhythmic structure of verse
questions.optiond: tracing family descent of poeple in verse
questions.correction: Lineation in poetry is how lines are divided and where they end in relation to a clause or thought. Having a line break at the end of a phrase or complete thought is a regular and expected pattern in poetry.

questions.question: The subject matter of a literary work is the
questions.correction: The subject matter of a literary work refers to the main topic or the essence of the work, which is also known as the theme. The theme is the central idea or message that the writer wants to communicate to the reader. It is different from the plot, setting, and structure. The plot refers to the sequence of events in the story, the setting refers to the time and place where the story takes place, and the structure refers to how the story is organized.

questions.question: A structural arrangement of unit of composition by which one element of equal importance with another is similarly placed is called
questions.correction: The value of the comparison is always achieved in the end e.g My mum is a sister, my sister is a mum.

questions.question:
This question is based on CAGED BIRD.
"for the caged bird/sings of freedom.",

The poetic device used in this expression is____
questions.correction: The poetic device used in the expression 'for the caged bird sings of freedom' is irony. Irony is a figure of speech in which the intended meaning is the opposite of the literal meaning. In this case, the irony lies in the fact that the caged bird, despite being confined, sings of freedom.

questions.question:
'Will college make you a better Olokun priest?
Will it make you serve our ancestors better?
Look at me. An able-bodied, strong-hearted priest of Olokun.
Did I go to college?
Gracy Osifo:Dizzy Angel

The literary device used in the passage above is
questions.correction: Parallelism is a literary device that uses the same grammatical structure in all parts of a sentence. In the passage, the speaker asks a series of questions that follow the same structure, which is a clear example of parallelism. Onomatopoeia refers to words that imitate the natural sounds of a thing. Metaphor is a figure of speech that makes an implicit, implied, or hidden comparison between two things that are unrelated, but share some common characteristics. Simile is a figure of speech that makes a comparison, showing similarities between two different things.

questions.instruction: This question is based on RAIDER OF THE TREASURE TROVE.
questions.question: "To fly flags of joy" Two figures of speech used here are
questions.correction: The phrase 'To fly flags of joy' contains two figures of speech: metaphor and alliteration. 'To fly flags' is a metaphor for expressing joy, while 'flags of joy' is an example of alliteration due to the repetition of the 'f' sound.

questions.question: One of the following writers is better known as  a playwright than as a novelist
A narrative poem must
Literature is studied as a subject at school  because
questions.optiona: it exposes students to the realities of life
questions.optionc: it merely gives additional work to students
questions.optiond: it teaches the use of words

questions.question: In The Flight to Australia', the following line occurs: 'Tier upon tier it towered, the terrible Apennines'. The figure of speech used in this line is known as
If we describe Kossoh Town Boy as an autobiography, we mean that it is
questions.optionb: a piece of writing telling us about the Life of its author

questions.question:
You cannot know
 And should not bother
Tide and market come and go
And so shall your mother


In this verse the poet uses

Another shoal of cars swam past.
One, in particular, caught his eyes, a long slender thing,
elegant as a swallow, all gleaming blue and silver;
a thousand guineas it would have cost, he thought.

In the first sentence, cars are described in terms of
Pick out the odd item

That year the harvest was sad, like a funeral, and many farmers wept as they dug up the miserable yams. One man tied his cloth to a tree branch and hanged himself. The mood conveyed here is one of _____
One of the following terms applies to the discussion of both tragedy and comedy
A character that is always against the interest of the protagonist is
questions.correction: Villain reflects an opposing character in literature (antagonist).

questions.question: The idea of metre as used in a literary piece is
questions.correction: Rhythm in poetry is marked by poetic metre.

questions.question: A hero whose weakness contributes to his downfall is called?
questions.correction: A tragic hero is one whose weakness contributes to his downfall.

questions.question: A travelogue is
questions.optiona: a record of the writer's experience during a journey
questions.optionb: the account of the experiences of an individual during his lifeline
questions.optionc: the account of the travails of a character in a novel
questions.optiond: a variant of a novel written in a free style on a writer's journey
questions.correction: It is more or less a literary work about a journey.

questions.question: A Literary work that ridicules the shortcomings of people or ideas is ......
questions.correction: A satire ridicles people or ideas; points out their wrong in order for them to change for the better.

questions.question: The exclusive right given to authors to protect their works from unlawful production is
questions.correction: A copyright prevents other people from producing an intellectual work without the permission of the author.

questions.question: Empathy is achieved when the audience
questions.optionb: vicariously participates in the stage experience

questions.question:
The long column of misery tended continually to grow longer, as the more robust struggled to get as far as possible from the pursuing French, and as the weaker fell farther and farther behind. There were enough weaklings in all conscience; even in summer the had been badly clothed, and even in victory insufficiently fed, and now it was winter, and Espinosa had been fought and lost, and the route of the retreat lay away from the ferle plains and up into the inhospitable mountains. The rain had fallen upon them in deluges for days and now as they climbed higher it was turning into sleet. and a bier cold wind blew. Ahead of them they could see the snow lying thick on the mountain passes through which they would have to climb, without food or fuel or rest, and with the terror of the French to urge them on. Disease had come inevitably to complete the work so well begun by hunger, exposure, and the sword.

questions.correction:

spiritual truth, or political or historical situation.

our society
